intro: Chromatotriccum lamii, commonly known as the red-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Chromatotriccum lamii is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
